For backward compatibility only.

For backward compatibility with WordPress 2.3 calling method: If the $file (first) parameter does not correspond to a registered CSS file, we assume $file is a file relative to wp-admin/ without its ".css" extension. A stylesheet link to that generated URL is printed.
For best performance, use $timezone = 'gmt', which queries a field that is properly indexed. The default value for $timezone is ‘blog’ for legacy reasons.
For built-in post types such as posts and pages, the ‘public’ value will be evaluated. For all others, the ‘publicly_queryable’ value will be used.

For compatibility with old behavior, numbered or formatted string placeholders (eg, %1$s, %5s) will not have quotes added by this function, so should be passed with appropriate quotes around them for your usage.

For each, check if required related components exist, whether the user has the necessary capabilities, and sort by priority.

For encoding the html or the $encode_html parameter, there are three possible values. ‘0’ will make urls footnotes and use make_url_footnote(). ‘1’ will encode special characters and automatically display all of the content. The value of ‘2’ will strip all HTML tags from the content.
For every step of the algorithm, the hare takes two steps and the tortoise one. If the hare ever laps the tortoise, there must be a loop.

For instance: When publishing a post for the first time, the post status may transition from ‘draft’ – or some other status – to ‘publish’. However, if a post is already published and is simply being updated, the "old" and "new" statuses may both be ‘publish’ before and after the transition.

For plugins replacing wp-cron, it is recommended you check for an identical event within ten minutes and apply the ‘schedule_event’ filter to check if another plugin has disallowed the event before scheduling.
For plugins replacing wp-cron, return the number of events successfully unscheduled (zero if no events were registered with the hook) or false if unscheduling one or more events fails.
For plugins replacing wp-cron, return true if the event was successfully rescheduled, false if not.
For plugins replacing wp-cron, return true if the event was successfully unscheduled, false if not.
For settings handled as theme_mods or options, see those corresponding functions for available hooks.
For settings which register a default setting in register_setting(), this function is added as a filter to default_option_{$option}.
For setups that use the multisite feature. Can be used outside of the multisite feature.

Format each link should take using the $before and $after args. Accepts 'link' (<link> tag), 'option' (<option> tag), 'html' (<li> tag), or a custom format, which generates a link anchor with $before preceding and $after succeeding. Default 'html'.
Format for the pagination structure.
Format string for page numbers. The % in the parameter string will be replaced with the page number, so 'Page %' generates "Page 1", "Page 2", etc. Defaults to '%', just the page number.
Format that the $rating is in. Valid values are 'rating' (default), or, 'percent'. Default 'rating'.
Format the information gathered for debugging, in a manner suitable for copying to a forum or support ticket.
Format to display the tag cloud in. Accepts 'flat' (tags separated with spaces), 'list' (tags displayed in an unordered list), or 'array' (returns an array). Default 'flat'.

HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized. Default empty.
HTML content that will be appended to the widget's HTML output. Default </div>.
HTML content that will be appended to the widget's title when displayed. Default </h2>.
HTML content that will be prepended to the widget's HTML output. Default <div class="widget %s">, where %s is the widget's class name.

HTML content to append to the sidebar title when displayed. Default is a closing h2 element.

HTML format for the Submit button. Default: <input name="%1$s" type="submit" id="%2$s" class="%3$s" value="%4$s" />.

HTML format for the markup surrounding the Submit button and comment hidden fields. Default: <p class="form-submit">%1$s %2$s</p>, where %1$s is the submit button markup and %2$s is the comment hidden fields.

HTML markup to prepend to the widget title when displayed.

Hooked to the ‘upgrader_source_selection’ filter by Theme_Upgrader::install(). It will return an error if the theme doesn’t have style.css or index.php files.

Hostnames may be in the form of hostname:portnumber (eg: wordpress.org:2467) to specify an alternate FTP/SSH port.
Hour of the day. Accepts numbers 0-23.
How long the connection should stay open in seconds. Default 5.
How many levels of the hierarchy are to be included. 0 means all. Default 0.
How many numbers on either the start and the end list edges. Default 1.
How many numbers to either side of the current pages. Default 2.
How often the event should subsequently recur.
How the list items should be wrapped. Default is a ul with an id and class. Uses printf() format with numbered placeholders.
How to format the comments list. Default 'html5' if the theme supports it. Accepts 'html5', 'xhtml'.
How to order nav menu items as queried with get_posts(). Will be ignored if 'output' is ARRAY_A. Default 'ASC'.
How to order outputted menu items. Default ARRAY_A.
How to order retrieved comments. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default: 'DESC'.
How to order retrieved networks. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default 'ASC'.
How to order retrieved sites. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default 'ASC'.
How to order the bookmark category based on term scheme if $categorize is true. Default 'name'.
How to order the links by. Accepts post fields. Default 'name'.
How to order the tags. Accepts 'ASC' (ascending), 'DESC' (descending), or 'RAND' (random). Default 'ASC'.
How to sort retrieved pages. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default 'ASC'.

How to sort the authors. Accepts 'nicename', 'email', 'url', 'registered', 'user_nicename', 'user_email', 'user_url', 'user_registered', 'name', 'display_name', 'post_count', 'ID', 'meta_value', 'user_login'. Default 'name'.
How to sort the list of pages. Accepts post column names. Default 'menu_order, post_title'.
However, if needed, you can always set the options yourself:
